import { Meta, Title, Typeset, Source } from '@storybook/addon-docs'

export const typography = {
  type: {
    primary: '"Open Sans", "Segoe UI", Tahoma, sans-serif',
    condensed: '"Open Sans Condensed", sans-serif',
    monospaced: 'Menlo, Consolas, monospace',
    clarendon: '"ClarendonURW-Reg"',
    graphik: '"Graphik Cond Web"',
  },
  weight: {
    light: '300',
    normal: '400',
    semibold: '600',
    bold: '700',
    bolder: '800',
  },
  size: {
    level0: 12.8,
    level1: 16,
    level2: 20,
    level3: 25,
    level4: 31.25,
    level5: 39.06,
    level6: 48.83,
    level7: 61.04,
  },
};

export const SampleText = 'Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur adipisicing elit.'

<Meta
  title="Design System/Style/Type/Utilities"
  parameters={{
    viewMode: 'docs',
    previewTabs: { 
      canvas: { hidden: true }
    },
  }}
/>

<Title />

<p>Use these classes to quickly adjust the style of text.</p>

## Sizes

### Small
<Typeset
  fontSizes={[
    Number(typography.size.level0),
  ]}
  sampleText={SampleText}
  fontFamily={typography.type.primary}
/>
<Source
  code={`<p class="miz-text--sm">${SampleText}</p>`}
  format={true}
  language="html"
/>

### Medium (default)
<Typeset
  fontSizes={[
    Number(typography.size.level1),
  ]}
  sampleText={SampleText}
  fontFamily={typography.type.primary}
/>
<Source
  code={`<p class="miz-text--md">${SampleText}</p>`}
  format={true}
  language="html"
/>

### Large
<Typeset
  fontSizes={[
    Number(typography.size.level2),
  ]}
  sampleText={SampleText}
  fontFamily={typography.type.primary}
/>
<Source
  code={`<p class="miz-text--lg">${SampleText}</p>`}
  format={true}
  language="html"
/>

## Weight

### Light
<Typeset
  fontSizes={[
    Number(typography.size.level1),
  ]}
  sampleText={SampleText}
  fontWeight={typography.weight.light}
  fontFamily={typography.type.primary}
/>
<Source
  code={`<p class="miz-text--light">${SampleText}</p>`}
  format={true}
  language="html"
/>

### Normal
<Typeset
  fontSizes={[
    Number(typography.size.level1),
  ]}
  sampleText={SampleText}
  fontWeight={typography.weight.normal}
  fontFamily={typography.type.primary}
/>
<Source
  code={`<p class="miz-text--normal">${SampleText}</p>`}
  format={true}
  language="html"
/>

### Bold
<Typeset
  fontSizes={[
    Number(typography.size.level1),
  ]}
  sampleText={SampleText}
  fontWeight={typography.weight.bold}
  fontFamily={typography.type.primary}
/>
<Source
  code={`<p class="miz-text--bold">${SampleText}</p>`}
  format={true}
  language="html"
/>

## Color

<p>
  There are a number of text color utilities that correspond with our color palette. We are planning
  on creating a more robust collection of choices that match components and variants in ways that{' '}
  <a href="/docs/style/colors/colors--accessibility.html">do not overlook accessibility</a>.
</p>

<table>
  <thead>
    <tr>
      <th>Class</th>
      <th>Example</th>
    </tr>
  </thead>
  <tbody>
    <tr>
      <td>
        <code>.miz-text--black</code>
      </td>
      <td>This is black text.</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>
        <code>.miz-text--black-300</code>
      </td>
      <td>
        <span className="miz-text--black-300">This is black 300 text.</span>
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>
        <code>.miz-text--red</code>
      </td>
      <td>
        <span className="miz-text--red">This is red text.</span>
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>
        <code>.miz-text--blue</code>
      </td>
      <td>
        <span className="miz-text--blue">This is blue text.</span>
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>
        <code>.miz-text--green</code>
      </td>
      <td>
        <span className="miz-text--green">This is green text.</span>
      </td>
    </tr>
  </tbody>
</table>
